summary: DOD isn't supposed to award certain contracts to contractors that require their employees to arbitrate claims of sexual assault or civil rights violations. Arbitration resolves disputes through a neutral third party instead of allowing employees to bring cases to court. DOD correctly included a clause restricting arbitration in most contracts we reviewed. The clause was missing in two contracts due in part to a problem...
title: Defense Contracting: DOD is Taking Steps to Restrict Mandatory Arbitration, but Additional Action Needed
